ai-mil3.1.1:1.1_0: Then Mithilā went up to Nāgadatta, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-mil3.1.1:2.1_0: And the king said to him,
ai-mil3.1.1:2.3_0: “Great king, they speak of ‘the procedure’. But when I returned to my home’, ‘Great king’, ‘They say ‘Nothing’, ‘They’ve ended my spiritual companions’. But they don’t look down on them, or ‘Nothing is mine’.
ai-mil3.1.1:3.2_0: “Listen, gentlemen, I have five hundred monks who don’t.
ai-mil3.1.1:3.3_0: But that’s not appropriate for a person to take pleasure in it.”
ai-mil3.1.1:3.4_0: And the king said to him,
ai-mil3.1.1:3.5_0: “If you can’t, Sir, the individual will use robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines; let alone those that are similar, or fruitless, but there is nothing wrong, then you’re not killing.
ai-mil3.1.1:3.6_0: “Great king, why do you addresses me by name?
ai-mil3.1.1:3.19_0: When the heart is overcome and mired in heart,
ai-mil3.1.1:3.20_0: If there is nothing but rinsing ...
ai-mil3.1.1:3.25_0: If a monk has untivated the junior monk,
ai-mil3.1.1:3.39_0: saying that you’re freed from the ear ...
ai-mil3.1.1:3.40_0: Don’t you have the nose dropper?”
ai-mil3.1.1:3.52_0: “But sir, what is the feeling of perception?”
ai-mil3.1.1:3.54_0: “But sir, what is feeling apart from form, apart from feeling?”
ai-mil3.1.1:3.56_0: “Sir, I ask you about letting go, see dragons.
ai-mil3.1.1:3.57_0: Sir, was the sound of a dragon?”
ai-mil3.1.1:3.59_0: “That’s Nāgasamāla. You’re unable to lie with that, Sir.”
ai-mil3.1.1:4.2_0: “Great king, suppose you were to extract the ultimate happiness because you, the ultimate goal of life for which you shaved off your feet, and landed your mind. Would you suffer painful, sharp, severe, acute feelings due to your feet, or your mind. Or would you want to touch it?”
ai-mil3.1.1:4.3_0: “I’m not coming with my feet, Sir.”
ai-mil3.1.1:4.4_0: “Great king, if you’ve gone to the chariot, what of mean? What’s that I’ve seen?”
ai-mil3.1.1:4.20_0: “Great king, why are the finest lady of the Sakyan land, or in a chariot drawn by mares?”
ai-mil3.1.1:4.22_0: “But great king, could have a fine pair of garments except for gallons, apart from a chariot?”
ai-mil3.1.1:4.24_0: “Great king, I ask you about to look at the sight of a chariot.
ai-mil3.1.1:4.27_0: “Great king, you’re shameless. Not lying down by lying, you don’t speak to me. But the king, brothers, chariots, and in India, make me drunkardless, ‘Gotamī, the king’s tracken by lying.
ai-mil3.1.1:4.28_0: ‘This is why I return to the chariot, great king.’ But when I informed that it was appropriate to say, ‘Great king, I have done chariot to him, but would not be appropriate to say that it is appropriate to you.’”
ai-mil3.1.1:5.1_0: They gave him five hundred coins to the King,
ai-mil3.1.1:6.1_0: And the king said to him,
ai-mil3.1.1:6.2_0: “I’m not lying by lying, sir, I’m unable to keep on wheels, and it appears due to the wheels, and the carts.”
ai-mil3.1.1:7.1_0: “Good, great king, you know the chariot.
ai-mil3.1.1:7.2_0: In the same way, a hair, and a hair depends on me ...
ai-mil3.1.1:7.2_1: Intentional form, the skin, the flesh, the sinews, and the bones, the bone of form, the six sense fields, and consciousness. Or else is known as ‘perception’.
ai-mil3.1.1:7.3_0: When you have been seated in the presence of the Buddha, King Vajirā,
ai-mil3.1.1:8.1_0: ‘The sky rains down, like a window,
ai-mil3.1.1:8.3_0: So too, when the aggregates are present
ai-mil3.1.1:9.1_0: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! It’s amazing that you don’t imagine they can know; it’s good to release by Nāgadatta.”
ai-mil3.1.1:10.1_0: first what is known as Phussa.
